q: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
h:
“Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage. ” —
Laozi

q: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.
h:
“The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.
h:
“Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.” —
John Wooden

q: People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.
h:
“People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.
h:
“The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast.
h:
“There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast.” —
Charles Dickens

q: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
h:
“It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one. ” —
George Washington

q: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
h:
“In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.” —
Robert Frost

q: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
h:
“To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.” —
Laozi

q: If you done it, it ain't bragging.
h:
“If you done it, it ain't bragging.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
h:
“Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.
h:
“True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.” —
Og Mandino

q: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life.
h:
“Realize deeply that the present moment is all you have. Make the NOW the primary focus of your life. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.
h:
“Before anything else, preparation is the key to success.” —
Alexander Graham Bell

q: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken
h:
“Be yourself; everyone else is already taken ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
h:
“Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.” —
Plato

q: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
h:
“Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.
h:
“Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.” —
Og Mandino

q: The truth is not for all men, but for those who seek it.
h:
“The truth is not for all men, but for those who seek it.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.
h:
“Opportunity comes when you continually push forward.” —
Sonia Ricotti

q: If you want peace, you won't get it with violence.
h:
“If you want peace, you won't get it with violence.” —
John Lennon

q: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
h:
“Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
h:
“Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.
h:
“Everyone has the right to make his own decisions, but none has the right to force his decision on others.” —
Ayn Rand

q: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
h:
“True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks. ” —
St. Jerome

q: Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.
h:
“Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
h:
“Get busy living, or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King

q: Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.
h:
“Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.
h:
“The world only exists in your eyes. You can make it as big or as small as you want.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

q: You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.
h:
“You must be willing to do what others won't do, to have what others won't have.” —
Les Brown

q: We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
h:
“We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
h:
“Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: Mind is the creator of everything. You should therefore guide it to create only good.
h:
“Mind is the creator of everything. You should therefore guide it to create only good.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are done by a series of small things brought together. ” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
h:
“Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
h:
“Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
h:
“No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.” —
Alan Watts

q: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
h:
“Think and wonder, wonder and think.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
h:
“The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
h:
“Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
h:
“Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.” —
Colin Powell

q: Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
h:
“Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.” —
James Matthew Barrie

q: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
h:
“I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
h:
“No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess. ” —
Isaac Newton

q: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
h:
“It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.” —
Confucius

q: Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.
h:
“Where there is anger, there is always pain underneath.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
h:
“The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
h:
“Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.” —
Abraham Lincoln

q: The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.
h:
“The only thing worse than being blind is having sight but no vision.” —
Helen Keller

q: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.
h:
“I learned the value of hard work by working hard. ” —
Margaret Mead
